children.text: The exhaust fans have not been fitted with a sealing device such as a self-closing damper to prevent air leakage from the building.
Part 3.12.3 Building Sealing of the NCCâ€™s Building Code of Australia (BCA) requires in section 3.12.3.4 Exhaust Fans that
'An exhaust fan must be fitted with a sealing device such as a self-closing damper, filter or the like when serving a conditioned space, or a habitable room' .

These exhaust fan air gaps must be sealed in all areas in accordance with the building code requirements above. This may require fitting a self-closing damper, or possibly replacing the exhaust fans with a type that meets the building code requirements.
